defs: = ಸಂಜೆಮಲ್ಲಿಗೆ.
(the first daylight) to appear or to dispel the darkness of the night.
to offer oblations to the Sun-God in the evening.
= ಸಂಜೆಮಂತ್ರ.
a worsipping of a deity in the evening.
a rigorous ascetic penance, meditation or worship.
a defensive covering, usu. of metal, formerly worn by soldiers to protect the body in fighting; a body-armour.
the official or distinctive clothes or outfit worn by the members of a particular group, as policemen or soldiers, esp. when on duty; uniform.
a padded, leather seat for a rider on a horse.
to prepare; to make ready.

to prepare or make ready for.
being aware of; having a feeling knowledge of owṇs sensation, feelings, surroundings, etc.; conscious.
named; designated with a name.
a word, phrase, code etc. by which a person, thing, etc. are called or referred to or spoken of; a name; an appellation.
the act of killing.
knowledge derived through the sense organs.
one of the eight minor Vaiṣṇavaāgamas of Vaikhānasaāgama.
(jain.) the complete and absolute knowledge.
(Buddh.) knowledge of an object, derived from its name, appellation or other adjectival designations.
(Jain.) (pl.) five kinds of absolute knowledge.
subjected to the four basic instincts or tendencies viz. food, fear, sex and acquisition.
(jain.) a living being that is subjected to the four basic instincts or tendencies viz. food, fear, sex and acquisition.
named; designated with a name or qualification; known by a name or appellation.
named for an office, etc.; designated.
respected; honoured; revered.
reverence or devotion for a deity; religious homage or veneration; worship.

the state of being awake.
awareness of one's own existence, sensations, thoughts, surroundings, etc.; consciousness.
a gesture or motion that conveys information, gives a command, etc.; a sign.
something that indicates a fact, quality, etc.; an indication; a token; a sign.
the Gāyatri hymn, a most sacred hymn in the vedas.
a word, phrase or code by which a person, thing, animal, place is generally known; a name; an appellation.
a complete army consisting of the four divisions - elephants, chariots, cavalry and infantry.
a punishing or being punished; punishment.
a term used to denote a grammatical process.
brilliant light; effulgence.
high or relatively high temperature; hotness.
a fever characterised by high temperature of the body.

extremely hot; burning, releasing great heat.
